intro: Manilkara calcicola var. colombiana, commonly known as the Colombian manilkara, is a tropical tree native to the Andean regions of Colombia. It belongs to the family Sapotaceae and is characterized by its evergreen leaves and smooth, grayish bark. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers followed by edible berries that are rich in oils and have a sweet, aromatic flavor. It thrives in humid, well-drained soils and is often found in montane forests at elevations between 1,000 and 2,500 meters. Due to its unique botanical features and ecological importance, it is a species of interest for both scientific research and conservation efforts.
